lab4

Class PiggyBank

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab4.PiggyBank

  • public class PiggyBank
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a piggy bank. A piggy bank can hold a fixed maximum number of coins. Once the number of coins reaches the maximum, the piggy bank is full and no more coins can be added. It is possible to shake the piggy bank to remove a single coin, or you can smash it to get all the coins out at once. However, once it has been smashed, you can no longer put any coins in it.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PiggyBank(int maxCoins)
      Constructs an empty PiggyBank that can hold the given maximum number of coins.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCoin()
      Adds a coin to this PiggyBank if possible; does nothing if it is already full or smashed.
      int getNumCoins()
      Returns the number of coins in this PiggyBank.
      boolean isFull()
      Returns true if this PiggyBank is full.
      boolean isSmashed()
      Returns true if this PiggyBank is smashed.
      int smash()
      Smashes this PiggyBank and returns the number of coins that it contained.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
